content.question: Bellah grew up in a family that taught her that life can be hard, but a positive attitude about stress is always a better choice. As Bellah was moving away from home and starting college, she experienced some difficulties with adjusting to her new environment and schedule. Which of the following best describes why Bellah would describe her difficulties as eustress instead of distress?

choices.label: Bellah’s genetic heritage would make her more predisposed to interpreting stress as eustress instead of distressed.
Bellah’s family taught her norms about stress that lead to her have positive expectations about stress as a young adult.
Bellah’s in a developmental stage that causes her to view stress with a positive attitude.
Bellah is experiencing delusional thinking about stress.

content.answer: Bellah’s family taught her norms about stress that lead to her have positive expectations about stress as a young adult.

skill.text: 1.B: Explain how cultural norms, expectations, and circumstances, as well as cognitive biases apply to behavior and mental processes.
